By using paytm for fuel payments at Indianoil fuel pumps, you will earn XTRAREWARDS points for every transaction.
XTRAREWARDS points can be redeemed and used for your fuel payments at Indianoil fuel pumps.
In order to redeem these points and use these points to pay for your fuel payments at Indianoil fuel pumps, you need to enroll into XTRAREWARDS program.
After enrolling, you can redeem these points into money in the wallet that can only be used for your fuel payments at Indianoil fuel pumps.
Minimum 100 points are required for redemption.
100 XTRAREWARDS Points are equivalent of Rs. 30.
First time redemption of your XTRAREWARDS points will lead to create a new Allowance Wallet issued by XTRAREWARDS within your paytm wallet.

You can access your Allowance Wallet issued by XTRAREWARDS within Passbook section in your paytm app after enrolling and first successful redemption of your XTRAREWARDS points. You can check your history of XTRAREWARDS money from allowance wallet passbook.

By scanning the QR codes at Indianoil pumps, the payments will automatically be debited from your Allowance Wallet issued by XTRAREWARDS first and if there is any remaining amount, the balance payments will be debited from the main wallet.
It is an online rewards programme powered by Indian oil for paytm customers paying for their fuel at Indian oil fuel pumps using Paytm wallet.

Aquarius-born are shy and quiet , but on the other hand they can be eccentric and energetic. However, in both cases, they are deep thinkers and highly intellectual people who love helping others. They are able to see without prejudice, on both sides, which makes them people who can easily solve problems. Although they can easily adapt to the energy that surrounds them, Aquarius-born have a deep need to be some time alone and away from everything, in order to restore power. People born under the Aquarius sign, look at the world as a place full of possibilities. Aquarius is an air sign, and as such, uses his mind at every opportunity. If there is no mental stimulation, they are bored and lack a motivation to achieve the best result. The ruling planet of Aquarius, Uranus has a timid, abrupt and sometimes aggressive nature, but it also gives Aquarius visionary quality. They are capable of perceiving the future and they know exactly what they want to be doing five or ten years from now. Uranus also gave them the power of quick and easy transformation, so they are known as thinkers, progressives and humanists. They feel good in a group or a community, so they constantly strive to be surrounded by other people. The biggest problem for Aquarius-born is the feeling that they are limited or constrained. Because of the desire for freedom and equality for all, they will always strive to ensure freedom of speech and movement. Aquarius-born have a reputation for being cold and insensitive persons, but this is just their defence mechanism against premature intimacy. They need to learn to trust others and express their emotions in a healthy way.

E-Mandate is a web based solution which has been developed by NPCI to facilitate payments which are repetitive and periodic in nature.
You can select any bank of your choice in the list and enter your account details to set up a one time mandate.
You can use either your linked debit card or net-banking credentials (depending on the bank) to set up your e-mandate.
Post successful setup of e-mandate, your bank will take up to 48 hours for activation. We will notify you once your mandate gets activated.
The maximum limit for e-mandate debit is Rs. 1 Lakh as regulated by NPCI. But, Paytm will only debit your exact bill amount for paying your bill.
You can pause or delete your automatic bill payment by going to the manage automatic page anytime.
There may be a time gap of a few hours between your auto debit of account and bill payment since e-mandates are not instant.
As a regulation, using e-mandate Paytm can debit upto Rs. 1 lakh. However, Paytm guarantees to debit only the exact bill amount from your account.

Material is the metaphor.\10\10 A material metaphor is the unifying theory of a rationalized space and a system of motion. The material is grounded in tactile reality, inspired by the study of paper and ink, yet technologically advanced and open to imagination and magic.\10 Surfaces and edges of the material provide visual cues that are grounded in reality. The use of familiar tactile attributes helps users quickly understand affordances. Yet the flexibility of the material creates new affordances that supercede those in the physical world, without breaking the rules of physics.\10 The fundamentals of light, surface, and movement are key to conveying how objects move, interact, and exist in space and in relation to each other. Realistic lighting shows seams, divides space, and indicates moving parts.\10\10 Bold, graphic, intentional.\10\10 The foundational elements of print based design typography, grids, space, scale, color, and use of imagery guide visual treatments. These elements do far more than please the eye. They create hierarchy, meaning, and focus. Deliberate color choices, edge to edge imagery, large scale typography, and intentional white space create a bold and graphic interface that immerse the user in the experience.\10 An emphasis on user actions makes core functionality immediately apparent and provides waypoints for the user.\10\10 Motion provides meaning.\10\10 Motion respects and reinforces the user as the prime mover. Primary user actions are inflection points that initiate motion, transforming the whole design.\10 All action takes place in a single environment. Objects are presented to the user without breaking the continuity of experience even as they transform and reorganize.\10 Motion is meaningful and appropriate, serving to focus attention and maintain continuity. Feedback is subtle yet clear. Transitions are efﬁcient yet coherent.\10\10 3D world.\10\10 The material environment is a 3D space, which means all objects have x, y, and z dimensions. The z-axis is perpendicularly aligned to the plane of the display, with the positive z-axis extending towards the viewer. Every sheet of material occupies a single position along the z-axis and has a standard 1dp thickness.\10 On the web, the z-axis is used for layering and not for perspective. The 3D world is emulated by manipulating the y-axis.\10\10 Light and shadow.\10\10 Within the material environment, virtual lights illuminate the scene. Key lights create directional shadows, while ambient light creates soft shadows from all angles.\10 Shadows in the material environment are cast by these two light sources. In Android development, shadows occur when light sources are blocked by sheets of material at various positions along the z-axis. On the web, shadows are depicted by manipulating the y-axis only. The following example shows the card with a height of 6dp.\10\10 Resting elevation.\10\10 All material objects, regardless of size, have a resting elevation, or default elevation that does not change. If an object changes elevation, it should return to its resting elevation as soon as possible.\10\10 Component elevations.\10\10 The resting elevation for a component type is consistent across apps (e.g., FAB elevation does not vary from 6dp in one app to 16dp in another app).\10 Components may have different resting elevations across platforms, depending on the depth of the environment (e.g., TV has a greater depth than mobile or desktop).\10\10 Responsive elevation and dynamic elevation offsets.\10\10 Some component types have responsive elevation, meaning they change elevation in response to user input (e.g., normal, focused, and pressed) or system events. These elevation changes are consistently implemented using dynamic elevation offsets.\10 Dynamic elevation offsets are the goal elevation that a component moves towards, relative to the component’s resting state. They ensure that elevation changes are consistent across actions and component types. For example, all components that lift on press have the same elevation change relative to their resting elevation.\10 Once the input event is completed or cancelled, the component will return to its resting elevation.\10\10 Avoiding elevation interference.\10\10 Components with responsive elevations may encounter other components as they move between their resting elevations and dynamic elevation offsets. Because material cannot pass through other material, components avoid interfering with one another any number of ways, whether on a per component basis or using the entire app layout.\10 On a component level, components can move or be removed before they cause interference. For example, a floating action button (FAB) can disappear or move off screen before a user picks up a card, or it can move if a snackbar appears.\10 On the layout level, design your app layout to minimize opportunities for interference. For example, position the FAB to one side of stream of a cards so the FAB won’t interfere when a user tries to pick up one of cards.\10\10

Everybody loves the Paytm Wallet, a secure digital wallet that lets you manage your money with a touch. pay bills, make recharges, send money to friends & pay for purchases across various brands and services like Uber, Zomato, and many more. It’s the easiest way to pay, one tap on your phone and seamless payment is done! However, you might see the cost of the ride disappear for a while from your Paytm Wallet balance.
2. What happens to my wallet balance when money is on-hold?
Your wallet balance is deducted and money is kept on hold in a special account, and is released to the merchant once the order/ride is completed.
3. What happens if I cancel the order/ride after booking?
On-hold amount is released in the event of a cancellation.
4. I have finished my ride/ my order has been delivered but money is still on hold. Why?

A. Sometimes you may see money not getting immediately released even after the order/journey is complete. This could happen due to some intermittent server issues. Rest assured, the money will be returned in your Wallet at the soonest.
You book an Uber from Point A to B. The total fare shown by Uber is ₹450
If you do not have sufficient balance, then Uber will prompt you to add money first
If you do have sufficient balance, Uber will put ₹450 on hold from your Paytm Wallet balance. You can see this in your Paytm Wallet Passbook
During the trip, you will see that your overall balance is minus ₹450.
Why is this amount on hold?
At the end of the trip, we will restore ₹450 to your Paytm Wallet, followed by a debit for the actual ride amount by Uber.
You order food from Zomato. The total order value shown by Zomato is ₹150
If you do not have sufficient balance (₹350 or more), then Zomato will prompt you to add money first.
If you do have sufficient balance, Zomato will put ₹350 on hold from your Paytm Wallet balance. You can see this in your Paytm Wallet Passbook.
While the order is being processed, you will see that your overall balance is minus ₹350
When the order is delivered, we will restore ₹350 to your Paytm Wallet, followed by a debit for the actual order value by Zomato.

When you place an order for a product/item/ride with our select partners, you might see ₹350 (or the cost of the order/ride, whichever is higher) deducted for a while from your Paytm Wallet balance. Don’t worry! Select merchants on Paytm can place some of your Paytm Wallet balance on hold till the time your order/ride is completed. This amount is safe with us and is restored back to your Paytm Wallet upon order/ride completion.
Example of booking an Uber ride

There were users who were misusing the system by using their wallet balance between order fulfillment and failing to pay the merchants even after order/ride completion. This feature now curbs such misuse and helps genuine customers with a smoother payment experience.
Selected merchants on Paytm can place your Paytm Wallet balance on hold. It is restored back to your Paytm Wallet upon order/ride completion
